## Description {#details}

This header provides classes for managing passes over SCCs of the call graph.

These passes form an important component of LLVM&#39;s interprocedural optimizations. Because they operate on the SCCs of the call graph, and they traverse the graph in post-order, they can effectively do pair-wise interprocedural optimizations for all call edges in the program while incrementally refining it and improving the context of these pair-wise optimizations. At each call site edge, the callee has already been optimized as much as is possible. This in turn allows very accurate analysis of it for IPO.

A secondary more general goal is to be able to isolate optimization on unrelated parts of the IR module. This is useful to ensure our optimizations are principled and don&#39;t miss oportunities where refinement of one part of the module influences transformations in another part of the module. But this is also useful if we want to parallelize the optimizations across common large module graph shapes which tend to be very wide and have large regions of unrelated cliques.

To satisfy these goals, we use the LazyCallGraph which provides two graphs nested inside each other (and built lazily from the bottom-up): the call graph proper, and a reference graph. The reference graph is super set of the call graph and is a conservative approximation of what could through scalar or CGSCC transforms <em>become</em> the call graph. Using this allows us to ensure we optimize functions prior to them being introduced into the call graph by devirtualization or other technique, and thus ensures that subsequent pair-wise interprocedural optimizations observe the optimized form of these functions. The (potentially transitive) reference reachability used by the reference graph is a conservative approximation that still allows us to have independent regions of the graph.

FIXME: There is one major drawback of the reference graph: in its naive form it is quadratic because it contains a distinct edge for each (potentially indirect) reference, even if are all through some common global table of function pointers. This can be fixed in a number of ways that essentially preserve enough of the normalization. While it isn&#39;t expected to completely preclude the usability of this, it will need to be addressed.

All of these issues are made substantially more complex in the face of mutations to the call graph while optimization passes are being run. When mutations to the call graph occur we want to achieve two different things:


<ul>
<li>We need to update the call graph in-flight and invalidate analyses cached on entities in the graph. Because of the cache-based analysis design of the pass manager, it is essential to have stable identities for the elements of the IR that passes traverse, and to invalidate any analyses cached on these elements as the mutations take place.</li>
<li>We want to preserve the incremental and post-order traversal of the graph even as it is refined and mutated. This means we want optimization to observe the most refined form of the call graph and to do so in post-order.</li>
</ul>


To address this, the CGSCC manager uses both worklists that can be expanded by passes which transform the IR, and provides invalidation tests to skip entries that become dead. This extra data is provided to every SCC pass so that it can carefully update the manager&#39;s traversal as the call graph mutates.

We also provide support for running function passes within the CGSCC walk, and there we provide automatic update of the call graph including of the pass manager to reflect call graph changes that fall out naturally as part of scalar transformations.

The patterns used to ensure the goals of post-order visitation of the fully refined graph:

1) Sink toward the &quot;bottom&quot; as the graph is refined. This means that any iteration continues in some valid post-order sequence after the mutation has altered the structure.

2) Enqueue in post-order, including the current entity. If the current entity&#39;s shape changes, it and everything after it in post-order needs to be visited to observe that shape.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Handler for invalidation of the Module.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the proxy analysis itself is preserved, then we assume that the set of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SCCs in the Module hasn&#39;t changed. Thus any pointers to SCCs in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// CGSCCAnalysisManager are still valid, and we don&#39;t need to call \\c clear</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// on the CGSCCAnalysisManager.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Regardless of whether this analysis is marked as preserved, all of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// analyses in the \\c CGSCCAnalysisManager are potentially invalidated based</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// on the set of preserved analyses.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> invalidate(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp;M, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/preservedanalyses">PreservedAnalyses</a> &amp;PA,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Support structure for SCC passes to communicate updates the call graph back</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to the CGSCC pass manager infrastructure.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The CGSCC pass manager runs SCC passes which are allowed to update the call</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">/// graph and SCC structures. This means the structure the pass manager works</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">/// on is mutating underneath it. In order to support that, there needs to be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">/// careful communication about the precise nature and ramifications of these</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="comment">/// updates to the pass management infrastructure.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="comment">/// All SCC passes will have to accept a reference to the management layer&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="comment">/// update result struct and use it to reflect the results of any CG updates</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="comment">/// performed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Passes which do not change the call graph structure in any way can just</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ignore this argument to their run method.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult">CGSCCUpdateResult</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Worklist of the SCCs queued for processing.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// When a pass refines the graph and creates new SCCs or causes them to have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a different shape or set of component functions it should add the SCCs to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this worklist so that we visit them in the refined form.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that if the SCCs are part of a RefSCC that is added to the \\c</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// RCWorklist, they don&#39;t need to be added here as visiting the RefSCC will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be sufficient to re-visit the SCCs within it.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This worklist is in reverse post-order, as we pop off the back in order</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to observe SCCs in post-order. When adding SCCs, clients should add them</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in reverse post-order.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a277c9d45b3b20308e166249fd56598ed"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallpriorityworklist">SmallPriorityWorklist&lt;LazyCallGraph::SCC &#42;, 1&gt;</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a277c9d45b3b20308e166249fd56598ed">CWorklist</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The set of invalidated SCCs which should be skipped if they are found</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in \\c CWorklist.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is used to quickly prune out SCCs when they get deleted and happen</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to already be on the worklist. We use this primarily to avoid scanning</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the list and removing entries from it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a6822f3e4bf1d3a55c967bf74b7419704"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl">SmallPtrSetImpl&lt;LazyCallGraph::SCC &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a6822f3e4bf1d3a55c967bf74b7419704">InvalidatedSCCs</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If non-null, the updated current \\c SCC being processed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is set when a graph refinement takes place and the &quot;current&quot; point</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in the graph moves &quot;down&quot; or earlier in the post-order walk. This will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// often cause the &quot;current&quot; SCC to be a newly created SCC object and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// old one to be added to the above worklist. When that happens, this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// pointer is non-null and can be used to continue processing the &quot;top&quot; of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the post-order walk.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#ab4eb37646445da693553b9728143f31c"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">LazyCallGraph::SCC</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#ab4eb37646445da693553b9728143f31c">UpdatedC</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Preserved analyses across SCCs.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// We specifically want to allow CGSCC passes to mutate ancestor IR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (changing both the CG structure and the function IR itself). However,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this means we need to take special care to correctly mark what analyses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// are preserved &#42;across&#42; SCCs. We have to track this out-of-band here</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// because within the main &#96;PassManager&#96; infrastructure we need to mark</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// everything within an SCC as preserved in order to avoid repeatedly</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// invalidating the same analyses as we unnest pass managers and adaptors.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// So we track the cross-SCC version of the preserved analyses here from any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// code that does direct invalidation of SCC analyses, and then use it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// whenever we move forward in the post-order walk of SCCs before running</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// passes over the new SCC.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#ac113dcaae09e52d6da7235e0757757f0"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/preservedanalyses">PreservedAnalyses</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#ac113dcaae09e52d6da7235e0757757f0">CrossSCCPA</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A hacky area where the inliner can retain history about inlining</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// decisions that mutated the call graph&#39;s SCC structure in order to avoid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// infinite inlining. See the comments in the inliner&#39;s CG update logic.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FIXME: Keeping this here seems like a big layering issue, we should look</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for a better technique.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smalldenseset">SmallDenseSet&lt;std::pair&lt;LazyCallGraph::Node &#42;, LazyCallGraph::SCC &#42;&gt;</a>, 4&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a500c2477bf6251954e52d6d9ef808e39"><Highlight kind="normal">      &amp;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a500c2477bf6251954e52d6d9ef808e39">InlinedInternalEdges</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Functions that a pass has considered to be dead to be removed at the end</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the call graph walk in batch.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a53676888f06cf2212c0126db2e9cf9dd"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Function &#42;, 4&gt;</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a53676888f06cf2212c0126db2e9cf9dd">DeadFunctions</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Weak VHs to keep track of indirect calls for the purposes of detecting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// devirtualization.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is a map to avoid having duplicate entries. If a Value is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// deallocated, its corresponding WeakTrackingVH will be nulled out. When</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// checking if a Value is in the map or not, also check if the corresponding</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// WeakTrackingVH is null to avoid issues with a new Value sharing the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// address as a deallocated one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a0a4386bac07827eaf6916d7da69a1cd4"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/smallmapvector">SmallMapVector&lt;Value &#42;, WeakTrackingVH, 16&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult/#a0a4386bac07827eaf6916d7da69a1cd4">IndirectVHs</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The core module pass which does a post-order walk of the SCCs and</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><Highlight kind="comment">/// When a module pass runs and triggers invalidation, both the CGSCC and</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A marker to determine if function passes should be run on a function within a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CGSCCToFunctionPassAdaptor. This is used to prevent running an expensive</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A helper that repeats an SCC pass each time an indirect call is refined to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="comment">/// a direct call by that pass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="comment">/// While the CGSCC pass manager works to re-visit SCCs and RefSCCs as they</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="comment">/// change shape, we may also want to repeat an SCC pass if it simply refines</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="comment">/// an indirect call to a direct call, even if doing so does not alter the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="comment">/// shape of the graph. Note that this only pertains to direct calls to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="comment">/// functions where IPO across the SCC may be able to compute more precise</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="comment">/// results. For intrinsics, we assume scalar optimizations already can fully</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="comment">/// reason about them.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This repetition has the potential to be very large however, as each one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="comment">/// might refine a single call site. As a consequence, in practice we use an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="comment">/// upper bound on the number of repetitions to limit things.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/devirtsccrepeatedpass"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/devirtsccrepeatedpass/#acd0c0040e438fabaa258412cec4ddbfb">DevirtSCCRepeatedPass</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/passinfomixin">PassInfoMixin&lt;DevirtSCCRepeatedPass&gt;</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/devirtsccrepeatedpass/#aca94cb07dc74736a1472ed8ab1159726"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/devirtsccrepeatedpass/#aca94cb07dc74736a1472ed8ab1159726">PassConceptT</a> =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/passconcept">detail::PassConcept</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">LazyCallGraph::SCC</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a571b2bbf074b46c75300bd8f14c5ab72">CGSCCAnalysisManager</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><Highlight kind="normal">                          <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph">LazyCallGraph</a> &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult">CGSCCUpdateResult</a> &amp;&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/devirtsccrepeatedpass/#acd0c0040e438fabaa258412cec4ddbfb"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">explicit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/devirtsccrepeatedpass/#acd0c0040e438fabaa258412cec4ddbfb">DevirtSCCRepeatedPass</a>(std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;PassConceptT&gt; Pass,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><Highlight kind="normal">                                 </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxIterations)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><Highlight kind="normal">      : Pass(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/std">std</a>::<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abfc9c7ecf70f66901e439f7c04ef3dbb">move</a>(Pass)), MaxIterations(MaxIterations) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Runs the wrapped pass up to \\c MaxIterations on the SCC, iterating</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// whenever an indirect call is refined.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/preservedanalyses">PreservedAnalyses</a> run(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph/scc">LazyCallGraph::SCC</a> &amp;InitialC, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a571b2bbf074b46c75300bd8f14c5ab72">CGSCCAnalysisManager</a> &amp;AM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><Highlight kind="normal">                        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lazycallgraph">LazyCallGraph</a> &amp;CG, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cgsccupdateresult">CGSCCUpdateResult</a> &amp;UR);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/devirtsccrepeatedpass/#a00a03c859c7c6d5e3940ed30642b3e9b"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/devirtsccrepeatedpass/#a00a03c859c7c6d5e3940ed30642b3e9b">printPipeline</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><Highlight kind="normal">                     <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>)&gt; MapClassName2PassName) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
